nodes.text: Watching him once on a mobile phone to Mr Blair striding up and down and wagging his finger I felt I was hallucinating: surely here was the Prime Minister issuing orders to an official rather than the other way round?
Mr Campbell exercises an extraordinary psychological dominance over the Prime Minister. It seems he can get away with anything

He has called him  a prat  in front of one witness has told him to  get a f------ move on  when he believes a meeting has gone on too long and instructed him to drop what he is doing and concentrate on something else  because it can't f------ wait
If somebody can insult his superior he has an high level of influence over his superior
If a subordinate can behave as giving orders to his superior he has an high level of influence over his superior
He has allowed television cameras into his office to record a plainly startled Mr Blair stammering out his praises.
If a subordinate can control and give dispositions about his superior's office he has an high level of influence over his superior
He has even - at the time of the  Cheriegate  affair before Christmas - briefed against the Prime Minister's own wife.
If somebody can insult his superior's familiars he has an high level of influence over his superior
